frameDefinitions: An Agent alters some Material in some useful way by means of some chemical or physical Alterant.
A Dependent state-of-affairs has a Requirement as a prerequisite for obtaining or occurring.
Money is a medium used for exchanging goods and services.
An entity goes through several versions, from initial to final.

An Agent or Potential_hindrance keeps a Protagonist from having a State_of_affairs that they need or desire, or, despite the possibility of preventing the possession, they allow the Protagonist to have the State_of_affairs.
A Material has been processed (generally industrially) to some Degree in order to make it more useful for some (usually implicit) function.
frameExamples: Native Americans <t>dyed</t> textiles with dyes made from cedar strips.
The atomic bombings were probably not <t>necessary</t> to win WWII without a mainland invasion of Japan.
The <t>money</t> for our daughter's college education is currently earning interest in a savings account.
His parents <t>deprived</t> him of food for days on end.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Agent</fen> is a person who applies the Process to the Material.
The <fen>Alterant</fen> causes a change in the <fen>Material</fen>.
The <fen>Material</fen> is altered by the <fen>Agent</fen> in some useful way.
The point in time or period during which the treatment of the <fen>Material</fen> takes place.
The location in which the <fen>Material</fen>s are processed, often a purpose-built facility such as a tannery or water treatment plant.
The state-of-affairs which cannot hold without the <fen>Requirement</fen>.
The entity or state-of-affairs that must be present or obtain in order for the <fen>Dependent</fen> to obtain.
An entity that has to be present for the <fen>Dependent</fen> state of affairs to obtain.
The time at which the <fen>Requirement</fen> is necessary for the <fen>Dependent</fen>.
<fen>Place</fen> denotes a location in which the specified relation between <fen>Requirement</fen> and <fen>Dependent</fen> holds.
<fen>Money</fen> is used as a medium of exchange.
The <fen>Item</fen> is one version among several versions (which may or may not yet exist), progressively getting closer to a final version.
The <fen>Potential_hindrance</fen> is the force which keeps the <fen>Event</fen> from happening, or does not prevent it.
The  is the situation, state-of-affairs, or state of having a possession that the <fen>Protagonist</fen> is kept from having.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the  person who keeps the <fen>Event</fen> from happening.
The <fen>Protagonist</fen> is the person who is kept from having the <fen>State_of_affairs</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Potential_hindrance</fen> keeps the <fen>Event</fen> from taking place.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the <fen>Potential_hindrance</fen> keeps the <fen>Event</fen> from taking place.
The substance which is altered in some useful way.
listRoleExamples: Stu treated <fex>the lumber</fex> with magical waterproofing fairydust.
<fex>In the US</fex>, the political clout of big city mayors is necessary to put this on the national agenda.
<fex>Israeli law</fex> effectively deprived the owners of their homes and lands.
Their parents denied them <fex>a brand new car</fex> upon their sweet 16.
<fex>The uncaring King Frank</fex> often starves his citizens of tax relief.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the Lumiere brothers' 1897 Arrival of a Train
